Articles.Content:
So yeah, whilest browsing the lego CUUSOO website I came across this:

reason im posting this here is because I want to raise awareness of this project, as far as I know this is not a project squad had put forward but if there is enough publicity behind it, this thing can become a reality

to find out more and support this project, as well as many others like it, click HERE
OMG... I would die from all the awesome.

You linked to a png, here's the actualy page: http://lego.cuusoo.com/ideas/view/49675

It would be really cool if this would get enough votes so it can be turned in to an actually kit.

I believe this was shown a few months ago on the forums. While some KSP sets would be awesome, you could probably make most KSP parts from rocket/shuttle lego sets anyway. If not, you can buy individual parts from various places online.

I myself have a lovely big box of Lego next to my PC, do I'm gonna see what I can make with those.
Lego and KSP belong together.
We need to invade the website with votes! let the kerbal invasion begin!

I would buy the h*** out of that!!!

Addition: Supported.

Edited April 8, 2014 by Fr8monkey

I believe this was shown a few months ago on the forums. While some KSP sets would be awesome, you could probably make most KSP parts from rocket/shuttle lego sets anyway. If not, you can buy individual parts from various places online.

I myself have a lovely big box of Lego next to my PC, do I'm gonna see what I can make with those.

This would actually make it *more* likely for LEGO corporate to be willing to do a KSP set, despite it's theoretically "limited sales potential." After all, if all they have to do is package parts that they already make in KSP-themed packaging, then there's virtually no cost to them, and each sale is almost pure profit.
I basically live next door to the factory, maybe IF someone could wip something up too encourage the guys in charge, I would gladly go over there with it :-D

I'd want to see an actual Lego rocket design first.

The main problem I see is that the best known stock craft, the Kerbal X, lacks the most iconic single part, the big orange tank. I'm not sure how this could best be resolved.

I basically live next door to the factory, maybe IF someone could wip something up too encourage the guys in charge, I would gladly go over there with it :-D

Now I wish I had brought all my lego with me when I moved for Uni...

I'd want to see an actual Lego rocket design first.

The main problem I see is that the best known stock craft, the Kerbal X, lacks the most iconic single part, the big orange tank. I'm not sure how this could best be resolved.

It has a Mainsail and the 1.25m tanks, though.
